website_summaries.verdict: A great pocket magnifying glass with a lens cover to prevent the glass from getting scratched or smudged.
pros: Protective lens cover slides up to protect the glass when it's not in use
Features a single bright LED light at the bottom of the magnifying glass
Easy to store in a pocket
cons: Though it's designed to avoid distortions, some say the shape caused more distortions

customer_reviews.title: Did not function as described. Still had the same inherent flaws.
customer_reviews.text: I hate trying to read the teeny, tiny print on prescription bottles. So, according to the description of this product, I should have less distortion of what I was viewing... NOT. Still had the same, if not more distortion than with a standard, handheld, five-inches-in-diameter magnifying lens. The light source is even worse than what I had previously that eventually died on me. This product did not live up to its hype at all.
customer_reviews.author: Borderbumble

customer_reviews.title: cheap plastic, bad design
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great, I have an older one just like this. I recently ordered two new ones and while trying to get the battery compartment open the cover snapped in half. Needless to say NOT A HAPPY CAMPER. I am not going to even try to open the other one's battery compartment. Very disappointing and frustrated, I don't want to go through the hassle of sending back. Most likely will not purchase again and will not recommend to others either. SUGGESTION the thumb grip should be placed at the bottom of the slider instead of at the weakest point. Very bad design with cheap brittle plastic.
customer_reviews.author: COLTOJTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Its ergonomics are ideal for my hand size, and it's easy to open and close. The LED is promptly activated upon opening. I'm using Panasonic Eneloops as my battery source, and couldn't be more pleased with the LEDs illumination. I bought this for one reason: to read FAA (hard copy) sectional charts, METARs, TAFs and other aeronautical charts. I typically use iOS Apps for such reports/text books. As a contingency, however, I thought it was only prudent to keep this Carson 5x magnifier in my kit, along with (hard copies) of my: Pilot's Handbook of Aeronautical Knowledge, '17 FAR AIM and Ground School/Flight/Instruments Manual(s), et al., etc. I recommend this "great" Carson 5x, "bigly."
customer_reviews.author: OCTrojan

customer_reviews.title: Magnifying Glass Good, Light Not So Much
customer_reviews.text: I had not owned a reading magnifying glass before, so I purchased a lower-priced version and got exactly what I paid for. The case holds three triple-A batteries, but if the cover for the batteries is on the light does not work, so I need to have the batteries exposed and easy to fall out if I want to use the light. The magnifying glass is square but only has an effective circular lens that is smaller than the whole piece, so reading is limited. I will invest in a higher quality item next time - frustrations of use not worth the cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this item for years and absolutely love it. The special shape and grind on the lens is far superior to standard magnifiers. The lighting is fantastic and the body of this magnifier is comfortable and easy to hold. It is fairly rugged as I have dropped it a couple of times and it still works nicely. The batteries are easy to change and last a long time. If this company comes out with larger versions I would buy those too! A fantastic price for this quality, I would pay twice that amount for it. I have several of them and use them frequently for all sorts of tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Not needed for use with gelsticks, if you have the Carson MS-44 illuminated magnifier.
customer_reviews.text: Besides having a very bright LED, the lens on this magnifier is too small to be very useful, and it also has quite a bit of distortion except in the middle of the image. I received a very similar magnifier free with a magazine subscription that has a much better lens - bigger, and NO distortion across the field of view. The drawback to the freebie is a conventional bulb that stopped working shortly after I first started using it. Last word - the Carson magnifier has twice the magnifying power, but that is what makes it so poor for more general use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Make sure this will meet your needs.
customer_reviews.text: You have to hold this close to what you want to magnify as it distorts around the edges. That does not help me. I use a different one now, which my boyfriend saw and liked and asked me to order 6 for himself and to give out. It has a bigger lens that is clear all the way to the edge and it has a light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe Product
customer_reviews.text: DANGEROUS!!! Accidentally turned on in my bag and MELTED the end piece and burned a hole in the side of my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlene M. Mccoy

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable for aging eyes. Great gift idea
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased more than a dozen lighted magnifiers. So far, this is the best one for several attributes: 1. Bright 2. 5X magnifying glass - way more useful that the usual 2X or 3X. 3 good slide out design, better than rotating. Makes it more portable and easier to carry around 4. square shape better than round. 5. high quality lens. I hope that the same can be offered in rectangular shape to cover broader reading area.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Chan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for mom when we go out to eat!
customer_reviews.text: Mom is going blind...whenever we go out to eat she brings a little flashlight to shine on the menu, but still has issues. This takes care of it being too dark to see AND to small to see. Now she can actually order what she wants instead off memory of what she has had before or heard on tv. I need to grab a couple more now (since she tends to drop or misplace things...).
customer_reviews.author: Eaglesgirl16

customer_reviews.title: Handier than a loupe
customer_reviews.text: We have an 8X loupe but find we're using this 5X magnifier more often. It's handier since it does provide illumination, the viewing area is larger than the loupe, and you don't have to get so close to the work to view it. I did crack the battery cover when I first opened it. The pressure from my thumb was all it took to do that. But it's easily reparable with a little instant gel-type glue, and the cover and the magnifier LED still work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Once in a while

customer_reviews.title: WHAT YOU SEE IS UPSIDE DOWN!!!!
customer_reviews.text: WHAT YOU SEE IS UPSIDE DOWN!!!!!!!!! The examples in the ad look rightside up. It doesn't say anywhere that what you see will be upside down. This is ridiculous. Maybe the one I got was just made backwards or something but....really? Otherwise, it does seem to be made well and the light is pretty good but, unless you are a dentist and use to working with a mirror, forget it.
customer_reviews.author: RAHAlphaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Wish the lens was a tiny bit bigger.
customer_reviews.text: I wish the lens on this thing was a tiny bit bigger with a slightly bigger viewing area. I've been having vision problems for a bit over a year now. This magnifier is a life saver for fine print. I can generally read fine print with this, and also great for prescription bottles. One small suggestion is I wish they stuck a little lanyard loop on it so you can hang it around your neck when you're going to the drug store.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out for me. But it might for you.
customer_reviews.text: The "curved" lens made it even more difficult to read the labels I specifically bought it for. Since I can't return it, and it does have a good warranty, I will find another use for it I'm sure. It slides out well and the light does provide good viewing. The magnifier itself is very clear. What I bought it for is a very oddly placed set of labels, and they are tiny, and under a handle. Kind of a nightmare to read. This magnifier would probably work well in other applications. It just didn't work for mine.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Ebe

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright and compact, clear image
customer_reviews.text: Much better than an older one it replaced, LED is very bright and masked to only project into the rectangle of the viewing area, which works excellent. The lens always being covered saves a ton of scratches. I got this one as the version I had previously was just like this, but no lens cover, and it got too scratched up from just a soft pouch. Great to have around for identifying little things!
customer_reviews.author: Troy, just troy.

customer_reviews.title: Our technicians love them and use them daily.
customer_reviews.text: We work on aircraft and aerospace electronic (lots of teensy / tiny wires with itty bitty writing on them)...and these are a Godsend! They are very handy sized, provide a nice bit of illumination and just about the perfect amount of magnification for our tired old eyes. We've now purchased many of these and they are used all over our shop. All the technicians love them. The batteries appear to last forever (not quite forever, but a very long time) and they are reasonably robust. Can't be beat for the price!
customer_reviews.author: FlyboyyyTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. It did not work at all even after putting 2 new sets of batteries in it. The return policy says it is not returnable...terrible.
customer_reviews.author: jazzy1

customer_reviews.title: Great for small lettering
customer_reviews.text: Great little 5X magnifying glass with a LED light. It's small enough to fit in your pants pocket or purse and for those of us who are more mature and their eyes don't focus as well on tiny print, it's a godsend. There is a sliding cover that protects the glass and acts like an on-off switch for the LED. Three AAA batteries are required and not furnished. I sprung for the four pack so that I could have one at work, at home, for the wife, and a spare. It paid for itself right away when I had to read the battery number of the tiny battery used in one of my wife's watches.
customer_reviews.author: CountryBoy

customer_reviews.title: Battery compartment is too hard to open/close. I updated my review from 1 to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: The battery cover cracked when I tried to open it. And I used rubber gloves to push on the thumb print. It would not slide, and the cover cracked in the process. I had to pound on the cover to get it back on, after installing the 3 AAA batteries, while the bright light was shining into my eyes. Has this magnifier been test marketed? [Updated review: I have changed my ratings on these magnifiers from one star to 5 stars. I liked the first one that I received, so well, even though it's cover was cracked, I ordered 2 more, and had much better results. Thanks much, to Carson!]
customer_reviews.author: Sam-I-Am

customer_reviews.title: Middle aged folks...these are handy
customer_reviews.text: If you’re middle age, you’ll find these magnifiers are very-very handy to have scattered all about. They are compact and portable so they easily fit in your pocket with the lens retracted for protection. The light is well placed and I haven’t had any issues with them failing to work but we’ll see how they holdup. I’m generally pretty gentle with things, so we’ll see.
customer_reviews.author: 3g5

customer_reviews.title: Love this little light
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for travel, glove box, or a bedside drawer. Since it closes up, it doesn't get dirty or scratched. It is compact yet powerful enough to read really small print. It isn't fantastic for extended use, as the magnifier portion is a bit on the smaller side, but it is amazing for reading small print on directions, pill bottles, etc. I can not recommend it highly enough. It also makes a great little night light for finding things in the dark as well. The light is quite bright.
customer_reviews.author: Carl M Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Why the heck didn't I buy this sooner?
customer_reviews.text: I was sick and tired of not being able to read all the fine print in the tiny instructions manuals that manufacturers have started including with their products so I took a chance and bought this magnifier. Holy cow! What a difference 5X with lighting makes. When you slide the protective cover down the LED light comes on and that lighting makes all the difference in the world. You have to be fairly precise about where you place the glass in relation to the print but once you get it focused even tiny dim print is very readable. I like this unit so much that I ordered two more just in case this one ever gets lost or broken.
customer_reviews.author: Squanto McGee

customer_reviews.title: Best magnifying glass
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had one of these for years and I finally got one for myself. For me, it is better than any magnifying glass I have used. I use it for inspecting small coins and jewelry. Everything shows up amazingly clear and bright. I have tried lots of magnifying glasses and even loupes but this even works better for me than a loupe.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: One of the few actual 5X magnifiers
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this brand and model for many years. It is the only magnifier that actually seems to be 5x, although I'm sure there must be others. I carry this in my pocket so I always have it available. There is a cover that is attached and slides over the lens to protect it and also turns off the light. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Received Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Received today and the product seemed to be open. It popped right out of the packaging when I pulled it out of the UPS envelope. It had a few scratches noticeable on the glass and the battery door was cracked. I was very disappointed in the appearance of the product that I just received. I would like to have mentioned if it functioned the way it was intended but unfortunately no batteries came with it so I couldn’t test out the light. I’m returning this product ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Mb

customer_reviews.title: A great magnifier
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother, who has macular degeneration, to carry in her purse. She can see well with it and it's a tremendous help to her in stores.
customer_reviews.author: Wrangler

customer_reviews.title: This is SO nice!
customer_reviews.text: What a great buy and a great product. So well designed, light-weight, has an attached cover protecting it from scratches- which have been a big problem with this sort of item for me in the past. And it has a built-in light. The design is so thoughtful, that when you open the cover, the light doesn't come on until it's fully open. Thus saving battery power for when you don't need it. And the price is certainly right. I Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: California Girl

customer_reviews.title: Purse Handy
customer_reviews.text: this iis s a lightweight magnifier that fits nicely in my purse - which is why I purchased it. However, when opened, the light either does not come on or only shines when held sideways. that is absolutely NO help in seeing items below me such a menus or reading material. Since i keep this in my purse, I've forgotten to complain before & now, ccan't get through to any support. This was a really BAD choice!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Best magnifier out there!
customer_reviews.text: I had to come back and buy more of these, The one I originally bought for looking at dates on older penny's was confiscated by my wife. So I bought more because Our daughter wanted one also. So Yes I would definitely recommend these to everyone. They work Great, and so easy to use. It also has a very bright light.
customer_reviews.author: B. Markwardt

customer_reviews.title: Mine did not work properly
customer_reviews.text: This magnifier was exactly what I wanted for my purse. Unfortunately I had to return in because the light does not stay off when closed. It goes off but then it turns on the LED while closed. I replaced the batteries and checked it several times to be sure it was properly closed. It still came back on.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: IT is just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I have some artist's colored pencils that are difficult to read the information printed on them. I also have some dip pen nibs that are difficult to read. The power of the glass and the lighting really make this easy. So far I'm very satisfied. To me it is worth the price for the convenience.
customer_reviews.author: DesertHowler

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: The light is not very helpful, but most importantly, the light does not turn off when you close the case so you're just burning through batteries.. When the light does work and you get very close to what you're reading, it is somewhat helpful. Might be good for checking a price on an item; it is worthless for reading. Can't use it, batteries burned out,, wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Molly1006

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. The unit is sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. The unit is sturdy; the light is bright and well aimed; and the lens is powerful enough to see the individual bristles of an inter-dental cleaner. At first I thought the sliding lens cover/light switch was gimmicky, but it actually works well. It clicks/locks in both the open and closed positions. I carry it around in a bag with other loose items and it has never opened on its own. Just know that this product is not really intended as a reading aid -- the field-of-view is a bit narrow for that purpose. I use it to see the dates on coins and coupons. It's also good for examining splinter wounds. I would definitely buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hiraoka

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product. It doesn't work and there are no refunds/returns!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this product! If it doesn't work, you cannot return it. I put in brand new batteries and the light did not turn on. I changed batteries and the light still did not work. When I requested an exchange, I was told there were no returns or refunds - under any circumstances. What? You can sell me a defective product and just say too bad???
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Barraclough

customer_reviews.title: Pocket size and illuminated
customer_reviews.text: It is pocket size and illuminated. The sliding cover that clicks and locks into place for turning on the illumination makes it difficult for the light to turn on accidentally while carrying it in a pocket. It's great for reading fine print while away from home. And the illumination makes it so that it can be used even in a dimly lighted restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: DonPTop Contributor: Quantum Physics

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly practical.
customer_reviews.text: The lens is good quality. The light is bright,steady, and it goes off when you close the protective cover. The cover itself means that the lens stays clean and scratch free. It stays closed in purse or pocket. It's well designed, well done, and well priced. Excellent value. Great little gift, too.
customer_reviews.author: AuntWie

customer_reviews.title: Battery gate cracked
customer_reviews.text: Opening by sliding the gate with my thumb for the first time to install batteries resulted in the nasty crack. The plastic is flimsy compared to the rest of magnifier that it seems it was subcontracted to a different company The rest of the apparatus works and feels as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Very handy for my purse
customer_reviews.text: It is a little heavier than I'd like, but a life saver when I'm shopping or in a restaurant with less light and need to read the print. It must look professional, I've been stopped in grocery stores when I've been using the MiniBrite, and asked if I worked there. I like that the lens is protected by the sliding cover.
customer_reviews.author: thekansaspyet

customer_reviews.title: Great little lighted magnifier
customer_reviews.text: I am in the process of sorting 80,000+ pieces of LEGO. Most LEGO pieces have tiny part numbers printed on them which can be extremely difficult to see. This little magnifier works very well with the built-in light to help in reading those tiny part numbers. Works quite well for my use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Too small to be of any value.
customer_reviews.text: The lens is so small you can only see a small portion of a document at one time. And the focal distance is off -- you have to hold the lens within a couple of inches of the paper for it to be in focus. It works as designed, I suppose, but in the end, it's pretty worthless. Should have just ordered a larger more expensive magnifying glass to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: stm

customer_reviews.title: viewable area only 25% in center.  get the carson popup 5x  its lense is much much better
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this. the lense is grossly distorted on most of the viewing area. the carson 5x popup uses a different flatter lense and is clearly superior. (I don't love the popup type, since you can't turn off the led's but the lense is better). "Carson LumiPop 5x Power LED is the better lense." for only .50 more is a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: WildBill

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and excellent
customer_reviews.text: This magnifier is the best. So compact and easy to use. I have them all over the house. Lots of printed material is printed with light blue ink or red and it's hard to read depending on the background color. This solves the problem. This is very affordable so I could have a number of them, including in my car and purse. They make great gifts, as well.
customer_reviews.author: SueM

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. I have extremely poor vision. I have five handheld magnifier units in my house. This one is awful. I now intend to purchase a plain small hand held unit to keep in.my pocket for use outside of my home. I will not even go to the trouble of returning this unit. Not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Dohboy

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The battery cover broke when I was opening it. Optics are good enough for me. To be fair to the maker/marketer, I don't know if something better is available. I would be willing to pay more if someone would direct me to something that is 1. Smaller, 2. Better quality, 3. Lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic, low magnification
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to view and check patron Id's at clubs which cn be dimly lit. I noticed that the product was very light in weight and it felt chwap. When I opened the battery compartment to install batteries, it immediately cracked. The light was not too bright but adequate. The magnifying portion on the instrument was clear but hardly increased the area viewed (I blame myself for not realizing that I needed a higher magnification). The product was relatively inexpensive but I wish that I had spent a little more and purchased a better one that was made more durable and with a higher magnification.
customer_reviews.author: Red Pill

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: This probably does what it's supposed to do, but I couldn't use it. It is so small and distorts what you are trying to look at in a way that wasn't for me. The product was shipped fast and packaged well, but not something I can use. I donated the both of them to the local thrift store so hopefully someone can use them.
customer_reviews.author: RMAC

customer_reviews.title: Viewing written material is UPSIDE DOWN
customer_reviews.text: Nope, this isn't the one. I needed a magnifier that would be handy and useful at a moments notice. Looking through the lens, what you see is upside down and never rights itself. Being returned as I write.
customer_reviews.author: JackieH.

customer_reviews.title: LIGHT and CLEVER DESIGN make this a GREAT MAGNIFYING GLASS
customer_reviews.text: We hate to admit we need a magnifying glass, but these are jsut what we needed. The LIGHT is nice and bright and comes on when you slide the lens open. Love the design and how easy it is to operate. The size is perfect. We keep them around the house and one in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Carson 5X MiniBrite LED Lighted Slide-Out Aspheric Magnifier with Protective Sleeve
customer_reviews.text: I like the LED lighted part of it because it helps to see the numbers. I use this on my job daily and it works great helps with no mistakes on my numbers. I have some vision problems but boy this little magnifier gets the job done fast. Thanks so much and will buy again..
customer_reviews.author: Heisenberg

customer_reviews.title: Good kid item
customer_reviews.text: This magnifier is perfect for kids. I bought it for myself but found it too small. Not a criticism at all, it's just as advertised. Kids who have that natural curiosity for studying leaves, bugs, or just looking at stuff will really like this. Great gift for a kid.
customer_reviews.author: christine wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for the Elderly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent magnifier that helps me see small details and small print. Be careful of the glass because it scratches easily. I have purchased three of these magnifiers. They come in real handy with a restaraunt menu.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Grissom

customer_reviews.title: My most useful magnifier
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to use. Fits in almost any pocket or glove compartment you’ve got. I keep it at hand on the desk. Great for restaurant menus. Bought one, used it, then bought two more for stocking stuffers. Will probably get one or two more as new gift targets show up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Linford

customer_reviews.title: Carson MiniBrite Lighted Magnifier
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is small enough that can fit my hand around it or carry it in my pocket. I does not come with batteries. Yet, it is small enough to slide across pages of a book, as you read sentences, it is not large enough to take the place of reading glasses.
customer_reviews.author: mary s

customer_reviews.title: Great size, light and magnification.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect magnifier with light. When closed, it's a perfect small size to carry in purse or even in a jacket pocket. The light is bright and the 5X magnification is great for looking at a menu in a dark restaurant or when looking at tiny print on a label, etc. And the price is excellent. Just what I was looking for to leave on my desk. Will order another to carry in my purse. And may order another as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Girl

customer_reviews.title: Small, but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little magnifier, good to keep in your purse. It works very well, and the collapsible cover is nice to keep the lense protected. I only wish there was a larger size. This lense area is very small, so it is not for reading books, but more for checking small items such as price tags, ingredients on a label, etc. If you are planning on using it for anything more than spot checking something, you will need a bigger magnifier, is the viewable area is only about 11/2" x 11/2".
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Extremely poor quality. Plastic everything. I put in the 3 required AAA batteries and while the light comes on, the case won’t close all the way. ( I tried 6-7 times) This poses a danger - exposing the batteries. Tiny light, not all that bright. I will be returning this, many better options!!
customer_reviews.author: L. E. Hurst

customer_reviews.title: I love these and keep them all around in the house and vehicle! @Carson..Please rethink not including batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I love these and keep them all around in the house and vehicle! Helps my stubborn 86 year old mother, who wont go get her eyes checked able to read, something she loves. All of mine work perfectly fine! You do have to add your own batteries and make sure they are in correctly. My only complaint is they should include the batteries as there are many elderly that purchase these and it is burdensome for some of them with weak hands and eye sight. Maybe the company will rethink this?
customer_reviews.author: PasoCreek

customer_reviews.title: The Carson lighted magnifier is perfect. It is a convenient size that is easy ...
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long? The Carson lighted magnifier is perfect. It is a convenient size that is easy to hold, carry in a purse or store. The lens is very clear. There are rubberized grips on each side to help hold the magnifier and slide the cover. The cover prevents scratches on the lens and controls the light switch. Slide the cover part way for no light. Slide it all the way for the light to come on. There is a "bump" so you can feel when the light will be turned on. The light is bright. The battery is easy to install and lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: sisu

customer_reviews.title: It's OK. It's a useful device for reading medicine bottles and so forth. Screen is small, though.
customer_reviews.text: It's a handy and useful little device. I use it to read the tiny print on prescription medicine bottles, comic strips, reduced size engineering and architectural drawings, and so forth. Its disadvantage is that the screen is very small (roughly 1- inch square) so you can't read a lot without having to move the screen. But I think it has its virtues.
customer_reviews.author: Bayard B.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Put Out enough Light
customer_reviews.text: The magnifier requires three (3) AAA batteries and then puts out almost no light. I would expect that with three batteries it would blind me when I look at it but instead, I can barely discern that it's putting out light! I'm returning it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Paula G

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted a portable magnifying glass and I got tired of the plastic lens ones he kept lying around the house to use when needed and were just not cutting it. On a whim I got this one and he is veryvery happy with it. He loves gadgets that are useful and this is.
customer_reviews.author: Grammie P

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for reading menus and small print!
customer_reviews.text: Nifty pocket sized reader-helper. Useful for reading menus and small print but the lens is probably not large enough for reading newspaper and books comfortably. Print becomes blurry very quickly as the magnifier is pulled away from the page. (You pretty much have to hover the lens just over the spot being read to use it.) The LED light is nice and bright. I like that it automatically turns on when the sleeve is open and shuts off when the sleeve is closed. (no button or switch to worry about.) Requires 3 AAA batteries that are not included. My dad was very pleased that Santa brought him this! :)
customer_reviews.author: Sue W.

customer_reviews.title: Never without it
customer_reviews.text: I like this magnifier so much that I have three, for purse, coffee table and bedside. I have macular degeneration and a 5x magnification is the minimum size that’s useful. As the condo on progresses, I’ve moved to electronic magnifiers but this still works for some purposes and is less cumbersome, and the price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Judy in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: No batteries
customer_reviews.text: The only fault I can find is that it arrived with no batteries. I've used these at my work and liked it so much I got a couple for around the house. I like these better than the smart phone magnifier app. Deduct 1 star for having to run and get batteries to use the light. Didn't realize that was the case. Nobody does that anymore - I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Elector

customer_reviews.title: Go everywhere magnifier
customer_reviews.text: Loved it so much I bought a 2nd one for my purse. I wish they would put a star or something on the top of user side I have blinded myself with the light several times until I put a nail polish dot on the user side of the magnifier. My friend had the same complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Kay S.

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE!
customer_reviews.text: I WANTED A MAGNIFIER THAT WAS COMPACT AND HAD HIGH POWER. THIS HAD EVERYTHING I NEEDED. SINGLE MAGNIFIER REALLY BRINGS THINGS UP CLOSE FOR THESE TIRED OLD EYES. OPEN THE CASE AND THE LIGHT TURNS ON. CLOSE THE CASE AND THE LIGHT TURNS OFF. EASY-PEASY.
customer_reviews.author: do it myself

customer_reviews.title: This is a Must Have To Read Those Microscopic Letters on Natural Supplements,,,
customer_reviews.text: We use this magnifier nearly Every Night/day,,, bought a Four pack, and now have to buy more because Friends and Family Love to keep these for themselves,,, Light is bright enough, and batteries are still good, after many months of use,,, at the rate Batteries are discharging, we can Estimate using this magnifier for Two or Three years before having to replace Batteries,,, Thank you kindly, for making a High Quality product at a Fair price,
customer_reviews.author: SageThyme88

customer_reviews.title: Best magnifier ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these 5x magnifiers. The older one got trashed by my husband so the battery lid is gone, no batteries and no light, but that's okay, it works fine without a light. I just keep loosing it and sometimes need the light so I bought a second one. I have macular degeneration and can't read the fine print any more, so I use these 2 Carson magnifiers frequently.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: The lens is quite good, very little distortion for the degree of magnification. I like the lens protector - it does keep the lens from getting scratched when I'm carrying it in my pants pocket. I use this magnifier to read normal size print; it is necessary for me to be able to read price labels in stores. The 3 AAA batteries will last many times longer than the button cells on other LED lit units. I have purchased a second unit so that I'll have one available if I should lose the one. I carry with me every time I leave my house.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S Guehring

customer_reviews.title: Great for Limited Use with VERY SMALL Print - 5 TIMES Magnifier - Food Labels, Terms & Conditions etc.
customer_reviews.text: When i need to read very small print, this is my go to item. It is small and can be carried in a pocket to take on shopping trips to read the tiny print on food labels. This is a small magnifier. It is NOT useful for reading lots of text like in a magazine or book, but great for the smaller print like at the bottom of an advertisement or for me when reading food labels. The 5x magnification makes reading this extra small print very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Open & Honest

customer_reviews.title: alright
customer_reviews.text: con: seems to be cheaply made, does not seem to be built for long-lasting use. no light diffuser for the LED Notifiable distortion of characters on corners of the lens. Pro: so cheap Slide on the cover, easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Hannibal

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me too small
customer_reviews.text: The lens was so small that this did not work for me. It covered too little of what I was magnifying. 5X magnification meant you also had to keep the lens very close to what you were looking at. Be aware that this seller does not allow returns even though it does not state this on the product information page.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Anne

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: A pocket size retractable magnifying glass with light is awesome for me. There's nothing not to like about it. Nicely made. The only one thing I don't like was it's made in CHINA NOT AMERICA 😩. But everything is perfect. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: E. M.

customer_reviews.title: good for viewing ants for extended lighting times. fonts too
customer_reviews.text: 5X mag is amazingly big for the small text I typically need to view. For instance, if you want to read a medium sentence, good luck. Maybe 3X would be better for me. I've also learned I prefer the button-press lighting process to this Slide it out, because I don't need to leave the light on long to read what I need. IF you want longer reading, of short 3-word text, this is for you. Or looking closely at how the print and font is rendered. Or for viewing Ants and such.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Henerey

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed with this
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed with this. Distortion everywhere except the center of the lens makes it necessary to hold the magnifier up close, just an inch or two away from my eyes, and hold what I'm looking at up close on the other side of the lens. Because the central area that's magnified is the only part that's not distorted, if I'm looking at print, there's a very small range of vision that is legible, not distorted and hard to see clearly. I would have rather spent a little more and gotten something better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I purchased my first magnifier like this one from my low vision optometrist for $25
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first magnifier like this one from my low vision optometrist for $25.00. It was a “SmartMag” by Mattingly Low vision. When I searched for another online I found this item by Carson and ordered one. The original has a little bit smoother plastic; but, is otherwise identical. It’s good enough that I’ve ordered another for backup in case I lose one of them. I would very much recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: John Lydic

customer_reviews.title: Company must have changed them
customer_reviews.text: Horrible light! I had bought these before for my father and they were great! They changed the light somehow and these give off very poor light in comparison to the previous one!
customer_reviews.author: Lou Ann Saylor

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, can't go wrong. Strong, clear magnification. I purchased to read microscopic drug labels in hospital pharmacy, but will probably find many more uses, like digging out splinters. Lens is very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jack O.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tool for Vision Issues
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for our elderly parent who needs a little help reading due to macular degeneration. The magnifier combined with the flashlight is very convenient and useful. The light is bright enough to help read, but not so bright where it would bring attention to anyone using it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3. One for my nightstand, one for my purse, and one for my living room. I like how it fits into my purse. I use it at the grocery store for reading labels. I use the one in my bedroom as a reading light. The one I keep in the living room is very handy for when I need it. The light is very bright.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne McConnell

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE BEST MAGNIFIER EVER AND I'VE HAD DOZENS
customer_reviews.text: The light is not overpowering, the magnification is perfect It's small and compact. It uses 3 AAA battery's and not those stupid button cells so it lasts for months if not longer. A great purchase. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: alan liebowitz

customer_reviews.title: If you are patient, it works well.
customer_reviews.text: The product works well, although I haven't tried it with a battery yet. It's compact, and slides shut to protect the glass - which I really like. But the window itself is a bit small, so if you want to read fine print on a coupon or ingredient label on a very small package, you really have to focus the glass and move it back and forth to read a complete sentece because the optimum viewing point is located at the center of the square glass not the entire square. If you are patient, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: ~~C~~

customer_reviews.title: Nice portable magnifier...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mom with Macular Degeneration... is fine for most, did not help her as she needs more magnification. She can use it for her personal telephone book and find a number that she knows is there. Not effective for reading large amounts of information
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie T.

customer_reviews.title: The magnification is not the best and the lighting is also not the best however ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed something for quick lighted magnification and this did the job. The magnification is not the best and the lighting is also not the best however it is useful for something that is in a casual scenario would not recommend for professional use. A typical scenario would be to read a book at night or to magnify some text with people with some Vision issues in general however the device performs to its specs and expectations
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Gor

customer_reviews.title: flimsy battery cover
customer_reviews.text: This magnifier works really well, however when I went to put in the batteries the cover cracked in two. So brand new item with tape holding the cover together. Not expensive enough to return, but disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: barbara ann

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: This magnifier is just OK. The slide cover mechanism is a little cumbersome - it does work, but not as smooth as I had expected. Overall not quite the quality I wanted. My major issue is with the magnifier glass/plastic portion. There is a lot of distortion around the edges. The usable portion is a smaller circle in the center of the area. The item is not big to begin with, so you're not getting the full magnification across the entire lens area that you might want or need. I generally reach for my non-lighted L-shaped 3 X 5 glass magnifier with an inset circle with stronger magnification for the really tiny close-up magnification rather than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Capricorn One

customer_reviews.title: Just What The Doctor Ordered
customer_reviews.text: Now, with this little lighted 5x magnifier, I can read fine print even in the dark. While it's not quite strong enough to allow one to see a pimple on a flea's butt, (not that fleas get pimples on their butts), it's great for reading tiny print, like the kind you find on medication bottles. If I would have had this magnifier sooner, I might not have mistaken those little blue "aches-and-pain pills" for those other little blue pills; you know, the ones that send you to the doctor after four hours rigid exercise.
customer_reviews.author: John WilcoxTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: battery case difficult to open & close
customer_reviews.text: The battery door was difficult to slide open. I had to use firm pressure with my thumb causing the door to crack superficially. Also it was difficult to close the door. Once it place, I had to firmly hit the bottom of the door with my palm to finally get it to slip fully into place. Otherwise, the light and lens are good. I like the way the lens is protected to keep it clean. I'm afraid though that the battery door will crack further when batteries need to be changed. But the price is right for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Roth

customer_reviews.title: Massive distortion.  Weak LED.  Totally useless.
customer_reviews.text: Even if this was free, even if they paid me, I wouldn’t use this ‘magnifying’ lens. Cheap plastic. I should have read the 1 star reviews but for some reason I didn’t this time. That’ll teach me.
customer_reviews.author: Customer since 1918

customer_reviews.title: Handy for reading the really small print
customer_reviews.text: Like the expiration date on coupons. I find I need more light to be able to read that small print. This is so handy and small enough to carry with me so I can read the directions on the pill bottle in the pharmacy.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: This Magnifier is well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The Carson 5X magnifier is my personal favorite for these reasons. The lens cover is well designed. It has a necessary light that illuminates what your viewing. It uses AA batteries, not the expensive coin sized batteries that are hard to find. I bought four to give to family members.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: very short focal lenght, need to be able to get the magnifier very close to the target
customer_reviews.text: Ok, but the lens needs to be very close to the surface to be able to focus. Very small focal length, in other words, about 1 - 1.5". So if you cannot get the magnifier close to the surface you're trying to read, you are screwed. For example, could be a problem when looking at components of an electronic device if other components do not allow you to get close to the target.
customer_reviews.author: Ja

customer_reviews.title: You're never too young to see clearly
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid my husband would be insulted when I got this for him ( since he's younger than me ), but he actually uses it on a daily basis. He has found it comes in really handy....much better than my magnifying glass and a flashlight!
customer_reviews.author: AMT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. I work in a job where I ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I work in a job where I have to read tiny serial numbers off of products and this always stays in my pocket. People always ask me where I got it and my co-workers borrow it from me. I lost my first one and purchased a second one. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lorne

customer_reviews.title: Good magnification and no distortion!
customer_reviews.text: This magnifying glass has better magnification than the drugstore magnifiers! My mom has problems with her vision and we had gotten her some magnifying glasses "as seen on TV", but they were terrible; distorted and not good magnification. She tried these and says they are much better than her 2X magnifying glass, or those glasses. They don't distort the image/words of what you are magnifying either; and come with a light besides. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Terri262

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One for my toolbox at work and another for my workbench at home. I'm pushing 60 years old and my up close eyesight is not what it was forty years ago and bifocals are a pain. These are great. Well lit and a big magnifier window so that you can see clearly. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Alerich

customer_reviews.title: Magnifier with a Light - Yes!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product! The 5X Carson Lighted Slide Magnifier makes reading fine print on prescription bottles, menus in dimly lit restaurants, product info sheets, etc so much easier.... effortless. I really can't live without it! Try it as it's well worth the price. Christine K.
customer_reviews.author: Christine K.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply mde
customer_reviews.text: The one I received is a piece of junk. I cannot get the batteries in straight. Light doesn’t turn on due to that. Really disappointed in this item. Seems very cheap. I don’t recommend. (From the one I received)
customer_reviews.author: Amy G

customer_reviews.title: Good magnifying glass
customer_reviews.text: What is inconvenient about this lighted magnifying glass is that it needs three batteries to use the light function . It would be best and more economical if it only used one battery. The magnifying glass works great with and without the light function .
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Wood

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving 3 stars because it's just ok. The light is bright. The magnifier is good. BUT it's thick and it's heavy with the batteries in. I wanted something for my purse and it's just not serviceable for that. I had a Great Point magnifier for almost 8 and it runs on two small 'button' batteries and it is very lightweight and slim. The Carson is chunky and heavy wit the 3 AAA batteries. I'll just order batteries for the Great Point. This is not serviceable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

product_meta.title: Carson 5X MiniBrite LED Lighted Slide-Out Aspheric Magnifier with Protective Sleeve
product_meta.description:
5x Power Magnifier with a Protective Sleeve

The MiniBrite Pocket Magnifier from Carson is a compact 5x power aspheric magnifier with a slide-out protective plastic sleeve that protects the lens from dust, damage and debris when not in use. This high power magnifier is great for a variety of uses including low vision from macular degeneration, reading, hobbies, crafts, viewing coins and stamps, reading fine print on menus and prescriptions, maps amongst other low vision tasks. 

 

Aspheric Lens Design

The sharp, distortion-free view is thanks to its crystal-clear acrylic, aspheric lens. The MiniBrite is a handy tool for those with low vision and is excellent for reading everyday items. The MiniBrite Pocket Magnifier is compact enough to fit in your shirt pocket or purse.

LED Lighted

It comes equipped with a built-in bright LED light. In order to activate the LED light, you must slide the protective lens cover down all the way until you hear a "click" sound. After the click, the LED light will activate.

Battery Information

Requires 3 AAA batteries (Not Included).

Warranty Info

At Carson, we strive to make sure our customers are 100% satisfied with the quality of our magnifiers. We are so confident in our magnifiers that we back them with a Lifetime Limited Warranty! Carson will repair or replace your magnifier if it is found to have manufacturing defects in materials or workmanship. Please contact Carson for additional warranty details.
feature_bullets: Pocket Magnifier contains a powerful 5x aspheric lens
Uses 3 AAA Batteries (Not Included) | Backed by Carson's Limited Lifetime Warranty
Bright Built-In LED Light | Lens Diameter: 1.3 inch (L) x 1.5 inch (H)
